intro: Charidia pulchella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Charidia pulchella is often found in disturbed soils and can become a weed in agricultural settings.
